poem:
The Long Wave

In the turning wheels' whisper  
echoes of a new dawn rise—  
black spokes spinning stories  
of power reclaimed,  
riding against the headwind  
of history's shade.  
These cyclists, true revolutionaries,  
pedal utopias into being,  
their journey a hymn  
of quiet resilience,  
heard in the rhythm  
of each turning wheel.
